comments: abs(a(n)) has e.g.f. sinh(sinh(x)) (odd powers only).abs(a(n)) is the number of partitions of the set {1, 2, ..., 2*n-1} into an odd number of blocks, each containing an odd number of elements. - Isabel C. Lugo (izzycat(AT)gmail.com), Aug 23 2004
references: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 226, 6th line of table.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe and Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..100 (first 50 terms from T. D. Noe)
mathematica: With[{max = 50}, Take[CoefficientList[Series[Sin[Sin[x]], {x, 0, max}], x] Range[0, max - 1]!, {2, -1, 2}]] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Apr 11 2014 *)Table[Sum[(-1)^(m + n) (1 + 2k - 2m)^(2n + 1)/(4^k (1 + 2k - m)! m!), {k, 0, n}, {m, 0, k + 1/2}], {n, 0, 20}] (* _Vladimir Reshetnikov_, Nov 07 2015 *)
author: _R. H. Hardin_, _Simon Plouffe_
